result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas A. Raiten was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs

*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

*Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
*Provide DNA sample if not already done so 
* Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Elizabeth Raiten except as required for attendance in Court Hearings and Family Court Hearing that is pending 
*Comply with terms and conditions of the injunction as set forth in Case 15CV329
*Transfer probation to Juneau County
*Early discharge from probation if defendant complies with the conditions of probation and his agent approves

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Douglas A. Raiten
Current: 1403 2nd Main Street, Elroy, WI 53929-1030 United States  (Effective: 08-09-2017)
Prior: 510 Lincoln Street, Apt. #1, Mauston, WI 53948
Plea/Sentencing Hearing set for 06/22/16 - attempted, not known

Defendant Douglas A. Raiten in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CM505 & 16CM134.

3:32 p.m  Court calls case and state the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Initial Appearance not completed on 16CM134 done so today - will plead no contest to Count 1 and not guilty to count 2.

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered on Count 2.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CM505:
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - No contest 
Count 4 - DRI

16CM134:
Count 1 - No contest 
Count 2 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 & 3 on 15CM505 and Count 1 of 16CM134.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 2 & 4 of 15CM505 are DRI and Count 2 of 16CM134 is DRI.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
State has complied with victim notification; victim does not appear in the courtroom today.
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CM505:
Count 1 -
160 day jail sentence - Imposed/Stayed and concurrent to Count 3
*If probation revoked will be allowed huber priveleges on 50% of the jail sentence 
Placed on Probation for 24 months
**Conditions of Probation:
*Maintain full-time employment.
*Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
*Provide a DNA sample if not already done so
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
*Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  *Elizabeth Raiten except as required for attendance in court hearings and family court hearing that is pending
*Comply with the terms and conditions of the Injunction as set forth in Case 15CV329.
*Transfer of probation to Juneau County
*Early discharge if defendant complies with the conditions of probation and his agent approves

Count 2 - DRI

Count 3 -
160 day jail sentence - Imposed/Stayed and concurrent to Count 1
*If probation revoked will be allowed huber priveleges on 50% of the jail sentence 
Placed on Probation for 24 months
**Conditions of Probation:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*Comply with conditions in Count 1 

Count 4 - DRI

16CM134:
Count 1 -
90 day jail sentence - Imposed/Stayed consecutive to any other sentence
*If probation revoked will be allowed huber priveleges on 50% of the jail sentence 
**Conditions of Probation:
*Comply with conditions in 15CM505
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge 

Count 2 - DRI

**Cash bonds to be applied to any costs

Current terms of supervision modified by Juneau County, this Court and the DA's office are to be advised of those changes.

Defendant Douglas A. Raiten in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
